comments.body:
This whole block is a little strange. It might be clearer to write it as:

```
changed = False

if owner and owner != db_info['owner']:
    changed = set_owner(cursor, db, owner)

if conn_limit and conn_limit != str(…):
    changed = set_conn_limit(cursor, db, conn_limit)

return changed
```
I think you mentioned in #40424 that this happens in PostgreSQL versions < 12, should we add the version here?
I thought about this, it may be fixed in minor/fix versions of supported versions like in 9.4.20 or 11.4. Moreover 12 version is not released yet and I compiled the devel branch of it
I think better to mention it in general without connection to a specific release (or we might add the release after 12 is released)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +66,70 @@    - C(absent) implies that the database should be removed if present.
    - C(dump) requires a target definition to which the database will be backed up. (Added in Ansible 2.4)
      Note that in some PostgreSQL versions of pg_dump, which is an embedded PostgreSQL utility and is used by the module,
      returns rc 0 even when errors occurred (e.g. the connection is forbidden by pg_hba.conf, etc.),
      so the module returns changed=True but the dump has not actually been done. Please, be sure that your version of
